intro: Gynema balsamica, commonly known as the "Indian bread plant," is a shrub native to the tropical regions of India and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, succulent leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its latex-containing stems. Its leaves are rich in nutrients and are sometimes used as a food source in rural areas. The plant also has ornamental value due to its attractive foliage.
